comment: This class is very easy if you read and do the assignments. I barely went to class and got high As on all of the tests. Dr. Alamilla is very kind and does his best to answer questions in ways that make topics easier to understand. Highly recommend.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Caring

comment:
Definitely make sure you don't skip this class. You learn a lot of information daily, and most of it isn't on the posted slides. 

The 4 major exams were all multiple-choice and very straightforward.  

Honestly, my biggest advice is to show up, take detailed notes, and talk to the TAs if you need help studying.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: this porf is so kind-hearted and wants the best for his students. I never studied for his exams, but I did do the homework assignments and quizzes. he is extremely knowledgeable about the subject in you can tell his true passion is teaching. I 100% would recommend it if you're looking for an easy A and a professor who really cares.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: I took Professor Alamilla for PSYCH1101 and he was great! This was a very easy class and he's an easy teacher. Do the Achieve assignments, read over the lecture powerpoints, and utilize the textbook and you'll do fine. I barely went to class and still got high Bs on the exams and did well on assignments.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: He seems like he cares about what he is teaching, but the lectures just seem like they drag on forever. There are a couple of homework assignments due every week as well as quizzes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Hes super hot. Its even better because hes a psych professor. Anyways hes super funny and his lectures are VERY interesting to say the least lol. He is kinda stern sometimes tho. Good professor, he makes class interesting but sometimes he can be a little bit stern and comes off too harsh. But the bad ratings for him arent deserved imo
rating_tags: Hilarious--Amazing lectures--Lecture heavy

comment: One of the more truly knowledgeable professors I have ran into. He is very direct and you will learn a lot in his class for sure. You will have to put in the work for the grade though.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: The professor is not available outside of class. Doesnt answer emails, nor has good communication skills towards students. You must show up to class on blackboard! Must take notes from the books and ppts! Doesnt give extra credit!!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: I have taken classes where I have put the work for and passed as for A&P 1 and Chem 1 & 2 got B's in all these classes and they were tough but not impossible like Dr. Amallia makes it to be. There's only pop-quizzes and tests, that's your grade. No extra credit, he's NOT the best to explain math. Far worst and unmotivates you to even come to class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Do not take this class unless you have a light schedule and are aware of the fact that your GPA will likely drop. This class is incredibly difficult, even for the brightest students. Every class is mandatory to attend, and learning is completely in your own hands. Effort isn't shown in final grade. Final grade only comes from tests and quizzes.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: DO NOT TAKE HIM!!! I didn't listen to the warnings and I regret taking him so much. He does not care if you fail, he will tell you that. If you arent good with math find another professor. if you don't read the book you'll fail. Gives pop quizzes. He presents himself in such an arrogant way that it makes him unapproachable.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: He is NOT a professor you want to take if you've taken few upper classes, this is why so many ppl complain about him. Very hard & NOT for students who need rigorous help. He has a researcher mind of wanting you to critically think for yourself, no straight forward answers. Read BEFORE class, Pay attention, Go to Psyc Lab for help! DO NOT SLACK.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Horrible professor! He does not care about the students and makes the class miserable. If you ask for help, don't even bother. He'll just tell you to "look in the book.". You're final grade doesn't project the effort you put into the class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: He's horrible! He is the worst professor I have ever taken in my 4 years of college!! He is a complete jerk to his students when asking for help! He is also a jerk because he gave me a 59.8 in the class and won't round it to a 60! I STRUGGLED to get that grade and I'm an A student! I at least deserve a 60 for listening to his bull every class!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: This professor has a great passion for making simple things ridiculously complicated. He gets frustrated and rude when people ask questions. Five pop quizzes, three tests, and a final are the only grades. Our class test averages were so bad he stopped posting them after the first test average was a 68. Do not take this professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Horrible, horrible professor. I had to drop his class the second week of the semester. I asked him a question about the material and he told me to "figure it out". I am the type of student who receives all A's and does not mind putting hard work and effort into my classes. Do not take him for your own sanity and GPA.

BEWARE!! This guy is a real jerk! He talks in riddles and DOES NOT EVEN TEACH! He blows every student off when they ask questions or when they express their concerns about passing his class, keep in mind, OVER HALF of my class is failing and HE LETS YOU KNOW IT! If you want to keep your sanity and GPA I WOULD NOT TAKE THIS GUY! TAKE SOMEONE ELSE!!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: This is by far the hardest class I've ever taken.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: His expectation is very unreasonable. the worst class ever taken in my college years.

This is the worst professor ever! If you want to keep your sanity and GPA then DONT take him! He doesn't explain anything and if someone has a question all he says is "well I covered that at the beginning so I won't go over it again" ALSO he said that our psych major will get us no where in life without a piggy back like stats! DO NOT TAKE HIM!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: He's my favorite professor of all time. He helped me get a passion for my major that I did not have before. I also loved his TAs and their feedback. I would 100% take him again. Just be willing to put in the work and you'll accomplish and learn more than you know.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Beware of pop quizzes--Amazing lectures

comment: My suspicion is that low ratings came from students who didn't put in the work. Dr. Alamilla is always available and willing to help, so long as you come to him before the deadline. Do the readings. Come to class. Start papers early. The material is dry by nature, so only take him if you're willing to put in the work.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: This is by far the worst professor I have had so far in my college career. He over complicates everything when the material should be easy. He is a tough grader and does not care about you as a person. Weekly labs due, pop quizzes, and 100 question tests. For your own sanity and GPA do not take his class. If you are a psych major stay far away.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR!!!! Your grade will not accurately represent your hard work put into the class. He gave me a failing grade for a group project that I did all the work on while he gave the other members a passing grade. Hes unfair and does not give clear directions or answers to your questions. Save your time.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: There's a lot of information to cover in this class. Pop quizzes, 4 tests you HAVE to study for (using your power point notes and check the readings he posts, you will pass). He's not clear on due dates and instruction and hes a hard grader (group project). You got to put effort to pass. Not that bad though.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: THIS IS A HARD CLASS. The teacher gives pop quizzes most classes. Labs every week that he does not explain well. Bad teacher and would not recommend him to my worst enemy.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: This class was mandatory for me to take for my major. I thought that this professor might have just received some rude reviews. I decided to give him a chance and I can honestly say that the reviews were not a lie. This is a 2000's class not a 4000's class. You will be over worked and stressing if you take this professor.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Alamilla is good professor but he gives no hand outs. Its best to read the chapter before lecture, that way you will have an idea of what to expect and can ask questions. Reading is key for this class, along with repetition of practice problems. Test gradually get harder but its not terrible. READ and take time out to practice  passing grade
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Professor Alamilla is not a good professor. He never gave enough time to write down the power points because he was always running out of time and never gave time for group discussions he would always cut people's discussions off. Makes you read so much, and then gives you 5 pop quizzes throughout the semester. Not a very helpful professor either.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Had him for Research Methods and Statistics. Great professor, if you're willing to put the time in to working for his class. He assigns the following: 1) A lab (due weekly) 2) A literature review over the course of the semester (which is heavy work. Don't put it off, use what you've learned, and you'll do fine.) 3) Four exams, incl. final.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: If you're not super into statistics, you'll spend A LOT of time working on the labs outside of class. Make friends with someone and meet up regularly to work on them together. He doesn't spend a lot of time going over the formulas in class, so you'll need to combine what you each picked up. It's really, really difficult, but not impossible.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: This professor is not very helpful at all. If your confused, your better off learning the material on your own or getting help from someone else. He doesnt realize that you are learning this material for the FIRST TIME and that you will be confused. His availability sucks, because you can only get help from him 1 day out the week. Not recommend him
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: it's not so much that Dr. Alamilla is a hard teacher, it's that research methods is a hard class. The book is your friend. There's a LOT of material, but he wants to see everyone do well. The class is fast paced due to the amount of material, but for research methods he is a solid choice. Pay attention, go to class, put forth effort: you'll do fine

If you aren't willing to take a professor who is going to challenge you, then you might as well not be in college. Dr. Alamilla does a great job of helping you LEARN. He genuinely cares about each of you and does his best to be reasonable even though the work load is difficult. In my opinion, you couldn't do better!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Caring

comment: Dr. Alamilla was a very nice guy, I just did not like him as a professor. His power points are very straight forward, but you have to come to class or you won't get the information. He gives pop quizzes that are worth 1/3 of your grade. If you don't read the book you probably won't do so hot.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Dr. A is a wonderful professor. The class is difficult, but if you put in the time and effort you will pass. I got an A by making study guides for each chapter & taking good notes in class. This class is so important and Dr.A prepared me wonderfully for Experimental.  If you want to go to grad school, this class is for you. Just work hard!!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Professor Alamilla was one of the best psychology instructors I have taken at KSU. He is extremely helpful and makes the class less difficult. There is a lot of work involved (go to every class, do every reading, labs, study, etc), but the class is not horrible if you make an effort. I definitely recommend taking him.

Dr. Alamilla is a great professor and also very kind. I am so grateful that his class prepared me for my current Experimental Design course. To those that think he is unfair--Did you not read the assigned chapters or did you skip class without supporting medical documentation? Not reading + skipping class  you won't succeed. Not his fault! ;-)

Hard class but one of the best professors to teach it. He does demand a lot! Honestly I never opened the stats textbook. I was shocked I had passed the class. He loves you to ask questions for clarification in class. Everyone told me you would have to take him twice. The person sitting next to me on the first day said he had. Just do the work!

Doctor Alamilla is awesome. I was scared to take his class after seeing his reviews on here, but he's been great. He tries to make a boring subject as interesting as possible. He always lets class out early. You do have to be on top of readings and show up to class for lectures. If you do both of those and ask questions when confused you'll be fine

Dr. Alamilla is a nice guy and very approachable. However, you better be prepared to work for your grade. This isn't an easy course. You will have pop quizzes so you must read the assigned chapters. Test are challenging, you better study and ask plenty of questions for clarity. Very helpful professor.

This class is not hard but the professor makes it harder than it should be. Be sure to always read before class because you may have quizzes. The lectures are way too long. He is always willing to help if you need clarification in anything but sometimes he works his way around the questions. If you can take it with someone else!

Okay so, Dr. A is a tough teacher but only because you have to actually do what he asks in here. You have random pop quizzes, a literature review (group or solo, just depends), labs, three tests, and a cumulative final. He curves the test grades so that the highest grade on the test will equal 100. Just do the work. It's that simple.

Dr. Alamilla is a really tough professor.  Don't get me wrong, he's a nice guy but a really tough professor.  If your borderline close to passing, two points away, he won't bump you up.  Make sure you get a good grade on the group research paper.  Everyone makes the same grade, meaning, if the people in your group don't do their part you suffer.
Best Professor EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
This class is very hard.  He could have been more helpful.  He is a very nice person.  But because the course is very hard it would help if the teacher will make the information more helpful.

Pop quizzes galore before he teaches the material. Long, boring lectures. Trick questions everywhere. An unforgiving attendance policy. A lack of respect for student's education. He does his best to roadblock your learning. Avoid at all costs!

I do not recommend this professor!!! The material isn't that hard but he makes the class harder than it really is. He doesn't really help too much if you ask a question he just beats around the bush and wants you to answer it yourself. His tests are SUPER long .... too long. 100 questions and a lot of them are confusing and misleading.

I like Dr. Alamilla , he is a great professor that is very interested in his craft. I think that if you are interested in learning then you will love having him as a professor. I think he prepares you for graduate style learning. I would definitely recommend this professor for those not interested in the easy A. ( currently taking the course)

Awesome professor. Awesome class. It changed my life. I think he is one of the brightest professors at KSU. I wasn't even interested in the material at first, but the class opened my eyes. I worked extremely hard; it was challenging. I was the only A in the class, but I definitely earned it. Great feeling! I felt such a positive vibe in his class.

Research Methods is NOT an easy class and I feel like his teaching style make it more difficult. Doesn't post power points online so you HAVE to go to class. Although he seems really uptight he is helpful when you go to office hours.

He's alright--not horrible but not my favorite. Doesn't post lectures online so you might want to go to class. Pop quizzes. 2 tests and a final (not cumulative). One big group project. He's cool but challenging for sure. He doesn't hand out very many A's but getting a B is doable!

Dr. Alamilla is by no means "easy." However, he does care whether his students are accurately learning the info. He does give extra credit which is very simple. There's a great deal of info to write down for this course and I agree that it would have been easier to have the powerpoints but Alamilla knows his info and is a really nice guy overall.

Dr. Alamilla is a great guy, but not an easy professor. One must also realize this is not an easy class. He will help you if you help yourself! Material can be challenging, but is reasonable if one has an understanding of statistics and actually does the assignments. A grade will not be handed to you by Dr. Alamilla! Do your work and attend class!

Dr.A knows his stuff, but he makes things difficult; if he posted his pps it would make his class easier to study for. I had a difficult time copying ALL of his lecture notes, during class, and paying attention to what he said because he covers SO MUCH in one class. He does not test on memorization but completely on concepts, so you better get it!
worst teacher i have ever had. i got 68.5. he doesnt give extra credit or anything. and no matte rhow hard u try he doesnt bump u up.DONT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR.

Alamilla knows his stuff, but requires you to read more than an average English course. If you are taking more than 9 credits, don't take this course with him, because you will not have time. He is a hard tester, lectures are monotonous.

Avoid if possible, he makes the class harder than it has to be with those exams. I'm in my last year and luckily had wiggle room in the spring to drop this class and pick up another one. Class is mandatory, and he don't post grades in vista. Makes it difficult to caculate average with his grading scale. Won't allow laptops/texting, boring lecture

No, he's not going to hand you an A. Your in College do the work. He knows what he's talking about and he wants you to know too! He is always open to help! Cut him some slack it's his first year. Very nice, and wants you to pass!

Don't get me wrong; Alamilla is a great guy and it available if you ever have question or need help, but you NEED to take notes and put attention in class. Make sure you study your notes, his notes and the textbook or you would never do good in class.

Dr. Alamilla was very helpful and always available for questions. His lectures were enjoyable and he did cover what was on the quizzes and exams, it was just very important to take notes and pay attention. He curved the quizzes and the exams because he knew they were hard, full of critical thinking questions.

I went into this class really excited about clinical psych, however, I left feeling confused and frustrated. He was off topic most days, struggled to control class discussion, and was very unclear about expectations. He spent a long time trying to explain what would be on the test, but didn't really get anywhere. Worked my butt off for a B.

Interesting, intelligent, clearly loves his area of expertise (multicultural psych). Quizzes were impossible, but midterm and final were not so bad. Read the book THOROUGHLY and memorize facts (population percentages, etc). I enjoyed the class, but it was stressful and required a lot of thorough studying of the text.

Yes you  have to work for your grade in his class,but you learn so much!I'm  really happy I didnt drop, and encourage other students to take the ethnic minority course. Dr. Alamilla is very fair and wants you to do well.As long  as you read the text and take good notes your fine. At the end you will have better critical thinking skills.

Avoid this teacher. He is not helpful at the least. He does not give reviews and he expects you to know so much information for a short 20 question quiz and 50 question exam. He is a nice man but DO NOT take him. I repeat DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR!!!!!

He doesn't give any reviews, so here's a suggestion..for the quizes, read the book and for the tests, read both the book and lectures. His tests/quizes are so hard, that he has to give an avg of 15 points to each test so that the entire class doesn't fail.  He's an unexperienced professor and distracts from the content which is very interesting.

Yes this is not an easy course, you have to read,come to class, and yes Prof Alamilla does push you to do well and not cut corners.He is very approachable. Topics are at times very emotional, but he teaches them well.Tests/quiz are hard,but just stay on top of your assignments. The research paper is not bad just dont wait until the last min.

Do NOT take this class. This teacher came from NYU and feels he has something to prove. Don't ask him a question because he will flirt around the answer. He does not say what will be on the tests, but lists the material we have read. SO much reading. The book is awful too, and the errors in it are too distracting to even keep one's attention.

Warning: Stay Away!!! He gives 2 quiz(which counts as a test grade) proposal paper & midterm & final. He is useless,he really can't explain anything clear for you to understand. Doesn't do a review for anything. Have to read the book. His exams are like a take home test. (meaning take home test are much harder)

I do not recommend this teacher at all.  He is dull and very unhelpful.  You have no clue what are on his tests.he tells you is everything is subject to be tested on.  He tells you one thing will not be on the quiz and its on there.  If you are thinking about taking this class, rethink it. He teaches it as if it were a graduate class. AVOID HIM!!!!
